botanical_details.genus: Petrocosmea are evergreen perennials producing low rosettes of fleshy, often felted, lance-shaped or rounded leaves. Five-lobed, tubular to bell-shaped flowers are produced in small clusters in spring

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in a cold greenhouse or alpine house, in indirect light, in a shallow pot of very well-drained loam-based compost such as John Innes No. 2 with added grit and leafmould; water moderately while growing, and sparingly in winter, and always keep water off the leaves; in frost-free climates, grow in shade in vertical crevices in walls or rock gardens so that rain will drain away
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown as soon as it is ripe, or by leaf cuttings in summer and autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be affected by slugs, snails, aphids, glasshouse whitefly, mealybugs, scale insects and tarsonemid mites
how_to_grow.diseases: May be affected by mildew and by crown, leaf, stem and root rots
